snippet: When Louisville’s Kevin Ware broke his leg, Luke Hancock immediately knelt beside his teammate and tried to offer comfort, a display of leadership that the team has come to expect.
abstract: Sam Borden On College Basketball column notes that when Louisville guard Kevin Ware broke his leg, Luke Hancock immediately knelt beside his teammate and tried to offer comfort, displaying leadership his team has come to expect; despite having played just one season for Cardinals, Hancock is significant piece of Louisville’s soul and has helped propel team into NCAA tournament finals.
lead_paragraph: When Louisville’s Kevin Ware broke his leg, Luke Hancock immediately knelt beside his teammate and tried to offer comfort, a display of leadership that the team has come to expect.

headline.seo: N.C.A.A. Final — Louisville’s Luke Hancock Steps Into Leader’s Role
headline.main: Not Recoiling From a Leadership Role for Louisville
headline.print_headline: Not Recoiling From a Leadership Role for Louisville
